meanings.definition: Of or relating to a hook or hooks.
meanings.sent1: The uncinal shape of the coat hook made it easy to hang my jacket.
meanings.sent2: The uncinal design of the keychain made it convenient to attach to my bag.
meanings.sent3: I chuckled at the uncinal appearance of the corkscrew, resembling a tiny hook.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had an uncinal quality, drawing people in like a subtle hook.
meanings.sent5: The uncinal pattern on the wallpaper added a unique touch to the room.

meanings.definition: A small hook or hook-shaped object.
meanings.sent1: She used an uncinal to hang the painting on the wall securely.
meanings.sent2: The uncinal on the fishing line helped catch a big fish.
meanings.sent3: The uncinal on the zipper made it easier to open and close.
meanings.sent4: His words acted as an uncinal, grabbing her attention instantly.
meanings.sent5: The uncinal on the hanger kept the clothes from slipping off.

meanings.definition: Hooked or curved like a hook.
meanings.sent1: The uncinal shape of the tree branch made it perfect for hanging a swing.
meanings.sent2: The uncinal curve of the road led us to a beautiful hidden lake.
meanings.sent3: The uncinal handle of the mug made it easy to hold and sip from.
meanings.sent4: Her hair had an uncinal wave that framed her face beautifully.
meanings.sent5: The uncinal bend in the river created a picturesque scene for painters.
